Download Data from the CDC

Source: R/pophive_download_cdc.R
pophive_download_cdc.Rd

Download data and metadata from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC).

Usage

pophive_download_cdc(id, out_dir = "raw", state = NULL, verbose = TRUE)

Arguments

id

ID of the resource (e.g., ijqb-a7ye).

out_dir

Directory in which to save the metadata and data files.

state

The state ID of a previous download; if provided, will only download if the new state does not match.

verbose

Logical; if FALSE, will not display status messages.

Value

The state ID of the downloaded files; downloads files (<id>.json and <id>.csv.xz) to out_dir

data.cdc.gov URLs

For each resource ID, there are 3 relevant CDC URLs:

  • resource/<id>: This redirects to the resource's main page, with displayed metadata and a data preview (e.g., data.cdc.gov/resource/ijqb-a7ye).

  • api/views/<id>: This is a direct link to the underlying JSON metadata (e.g., data.cdc.gov/api/views/ijqb-a7ye).

  • api/views/<id>/rows.csv: This is a direct link to the full CSV dataset (e.g., data.cdc.gov/api/views/ijqb-a7ye/rows.csv).

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
  pophive_download_cdc("ijqb-a7ye")
} # }
